tasks.task: Farming demonstration for hybrid corn benefits
subtasks: Introduce Bob Garst and Charlie Thomas
Highlight the importance of their partnership for seed corn production
Explain the capacity and modernity of the plant
Describe the process of drying, sorting, and grading Pioneer hybrid seed corn
Contrast open pollinated corn with Pioneer hybrid corn in a field setting
Point out the lack of stiffness and uniformity in open pollinated corn
Explain the deterioration of open pollinated corn due to fallen stalks
Discuss the issues with root systems in open pollinated corn
Describe the superiority of Pioneer hybrid corn in terms of stalk strength and uniformity
Showcase the advantages of Pioneer hybrid corn for mechanical picking
Present evidence of high yield (110 bushels per acre) and quality
Highlight the heavy root system and its benefits for Pioneer hybrids
Mention the efficiency of mechanical corn picking with Pioneer hybrids
Describe the process of corn picking with a corn picker and processing on-site
Compare open pollinated corn with Pioneer hybrid corn in terms of feed value and market price

tasks.task: The Scientific Approach to Corn Farming
subtasks: Emphasize the selection process for hybrid corn's ancestry
Highlight the consistency and quality of Pioneer hybrid corn
Stress the economic benefits of growing Pioneer hybrid corn vs. open pollinated corn

tasks.task: Corn Picker Demonstration
subtasks: Demonstrate the ease and efficiency of picking hybrid corn with a corn picker
Show the amount of corn harvested and the packing process

tasks.task: Field Walkthrough of Open Pollinated vs. Hybrid Corn
subtasks: Guide visitors through the observation of open pollinated corn field
Contrast features like ear position, stalk integrity, and overall appearance
Demonstrate the process of picking and handling both types of corn

tasks.task: Root System Analysis
subtasks: Underground examination of hybrid corn roots compared to open pollinated corn roots
Compare root depth, strength, and nutrient absorption in hybrid corn

tasks.task: Highlighting Pioneer Hybrids' Superior Feed Value
subtasks: Discuss the marketability and feed quality of Pioneer hybrid corn
Compare with open pollinated corn in terms of animal preference and market price

tasks.task: Visitor Interaction
subtasks: Engage crowd with demonstrations and interactive observations
Answer questions and provide explanations during the tour

tasks.task: Introduce Bob Garst and Charlie Thomas (Subtasks: Explain their roles, mention their partnership)
Describe the seed corn processing plant's capacity and modernity (Subtasks: Talk about the warehouse size, processing volume)
Discuss the hybrid corn production process (Subtasks: Explain drying, sorting, grading)
Compare open pollinated corn with hybrid corn in a field (Subtasks: Note the visual differences, explain why hybrid is better)
Demonstrate mechanical corn picking (Subtasks: Operate the corn picker, collect and load corn)
Conduct a root system analysis (Subtasks: Dig up and compare hybrid and open-pollinated corn roots)
Show the quality and marketability of hybrid corn (Subtasks: Present samples, explain pricing)
Engage with visitors (Subtasks: Answer questions, demonstrate corn picking)
Conduct a field demonstration showing the benefits of hybrid corn
subtasks: Introduce the partners (Bob Garst and Charlie Thomas)
Explain the seed corn processing facility and its capacity
Demonstrate the hybrids' superior root system (need to physically dig up roots and compare)
Show hybrid corn's resistance to lodging and uniformity in the field (physically walk through the fields)
Operate a mechanical corn picker and demonstrate corn picking (physical handling of the machinery and corn)
Describe the economic benefits of hybrid corn (e.g., higher yields, better market price)
Prepare and present samples of open-pollinated vs. hybrid corn for visitors to experience

tasks.task: Lead a tour and demonstration of hybrid corn benefits (covering all aspects)
Lead a guided tour of the seed corn facility and hybrid corn fields
subtasks: Give an introduction about Bob Garst and Charlie Thomas
Explain the processing plant's capabilities
Take visitors through the hybrid corn field for visual comparisons
